website_summaries.verdict: WD VelociRaptor WD1000DHTZ makes an excellent storage solution for housing a large amount of data that's frequently accessed and manipulated.
pros: The WD VelociRaptor WD1000DHTZ offers great performance and offers 1TB of storage space
cons: The new WD VelociRaptor WD1000DHTZ is noticeably more expensive than regular hard drives of the same capacity

customer_reviews.title: these are nice disks but watch out
customer_reviews.text: well i had four of these and i am a p rime member guess what after 2 years they died.. called amazon support (good luck) they offered one month of amazon prime for free i told them to cancel my service its no good just like the drive when they die i am screwed so now i am dealing with western digital support again all over email so i would say while these drives are ok if they die SON YOUR ON YOUR OWN
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable and probably the fastest HDD on the market ...
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable and probably the fastest HDD on the market. The mean time between failure is >150 years, keeping the computer turned on 24/365, according to the manufacturer. I use this drive as C: drive and keep the original drive as the F: drive. I have cloned my C: drive into F: drive, using the Adonis application, downloaded free from WD once every month for over 10 years. In this way, if something is wrong with my settings or I have some unwanted software, I am back in business in less than 5 minutes (by exchanging the data cable with the legacy bios and by changing the 1st drive to start in the setup with the new bios).
customer_reviews.author: Tien H. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my Ivy Bridge Hackintosh and love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive along with a couple of SSDs for my Ivy Bridge Hackintosh and surprising this almost keeps up with them as far as seat of the pants performance and feel is concerned. Some people have commented they are noisy but honestly in a room with normal ambient environmental noises it is virtually silent. However early in the morning when the house is completely still and quiet and i'm using this drive as a boot drive I can audibly detect a slight head-seeking noise coming from the drive, not at all annoying though. Overall love the performance of this drive and would recommend in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Sinister Crypt

customer_reviews.title: good balance between capacity, speed, and cost
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for a little short of a year now. Has been reliable as far as performance and data surface integrity goes. Upgrading from a consumer grade 7200 RPM drive, this was noticeably faster. I also did some read/write burn in testing with dd, writing from /dev/zero to an encrypted file (a faster way to make "random data") and then reading that file back into /dev/null. I was getting between 180Mb/s and 190Mb/s - considering the drive is rated for 200Mb/s I'd say thats pretty good since the rated theoretical max throughput is rarely ever reached on any data link.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, he was building his own computer so after he did his research he deiced on this one. It is fast...and he believes its one of the best on the market. He's had his for a while now and finds it very reliable, and hasn't had any problems. This product came on time, and was nicely packed to prevent any damage. What great it also has a 5 year warranty. The price is not bad for such an awesome product I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaz

customer_reviews.title: Good Gaming Drive 1TB
customer_reviews.text: These have come along way since they were only 250ish GB HDD's back in the day. Now they go all the way up to 1TB. Its a great size for putting all your games on, and any serious file conversion software, where your encoding and whatnot. Its not as fast a SSD but certainly a good alternative! With decent airflow this drive doesn't get very hot at all. I'm happy with this. I'm not usually a fan of Western Digital, but this is for sure one of their strong drives. I have 570 Power on hours and no issues in the s.m.a.r.t. data, or others so far.
customer_reviews.author: HOME SLICE

customer_reviews.title: Really super Fast HD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this an an older PC that needed a boost. The Mobo in this PC doesn't support ^g Transfer rate. But I still get Read speeds in the 180's using Crystal Disc mark That's runnin at 3gs Transfer rate..I can Imagine what its going to run at ^g transfer speeds Cached with an SSD!!! I'm Building a PC as we speak. I will be using a Samsung 840 Pro SSD for OS & Progs Then Most definitely one of the WD VElociraptors for some storage. The SSD will take over the cache of the Velociraptor and actually make it run like an SSD Drive!! Ecstatic with this HD.. My PC Starts in 40 seconds!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JJ50

customer_reviews.title: Quick Raptor Review
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these drives for years just for PC Gaming. Quick load times in all games but especially in Skyrim. Seems to have improved my load times when making and editing home movies and movies for Facebook. I was using a slower drive due to my old WD Raptors being too small for all my applications so I upgraded to this drive and really noticed a difference. Great warranty. Get what you pay for in this drive. Better price at amazon then at newegg. Recommend for PC Gamers, but casual users can save with a slower drive and never notice the difference. Good luck with your build and remember never skimp on your power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Keep the performance, save the pennies
customer_reviews.text: WD VelociRaptor drives are the only option in my opinion on 10k RPM HDDs. This drive arrives as a bare drive, meaning there are no cables included. However the drive works perfectly, slides right into my Hot swap bay and is ready for formatting instantly. Price is cheaper than SSD and still fast at loading times. I use WD Velociraptors for all my games and demanding programs, and keep my single solid state drive for boot. It is just not cost effect to run SSD across the board yet. Keep the performance, save the pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Grumbo

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable, built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Relatively quiet hard drive. I've been using this hard drive since 2015 and I still use it as my gaming / main windows installation drive. It's still quiet, and aside from solid state drives, I've never used a better one for gaming. I'm noticing the price on this has skyrocketed compared to when I ordered a couple years ago - taking that into consideration would likely make my review only 4 stars, but I got mine for about $200 and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Best spinning hard drive for a desk top system :)
customer_reviews.text: If you must buy a spinning hard drive, this is the one to get. Insert one of these into a system that once ran a 7,200 RPM drive and you will see the system boot almost twice as fast. Programs will launch faster. Updates will run faster. This drive is considered enterprise class and will last longer than non-enterprise drives. Fact: I re moved dozens of 7,200 rpm drives and added Vraptors into plenty of Dual Core desktop systems and my clients are always wowed by the difference.
customer_reviews.author: BiteMyTaco

customer_reviews.title: XP RAID 0 FROM YOUR OLD DRIVE
customer_reviews.text: Two of these raptors and WD Acronis software from WD website, and you can migrate xp from your old drive to your new drives without reloading XP..No f6 raid driver from a floppy disk. Format both new drives in driver mgr. Restart, enter bios and enable raid, this sets up both drives as one 500gb. Load raid driver from your mobo cd. Click on Acronis icon and migrate xp from your old drive to your new raid drives..This should work for windows 7. You won't need a usb memory stick..I can't believe how easy it was..
customer_reviews.author: Max Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Runs a Little Noisy, but allows programs and windows to load faster - I recommend this drive. Two Thumbs Up.
customer_reviews.text: Programs Load Faster and Windows Loads Faster. Well Worth the money. It does make a little more noise than the slower drives, but I still give it 5 stars because it is very good at what you need it to do. It works very fast and is very efficient and is rated for lots of use. Can't beat this drive unless you get a solid state drive (but they are pretty expensive for 1 TB
customer_reviews.author: r. krueger

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my boot drive, so it is much faster I can tell, no numbers to prove it. But it is noisy. reminds me of the first hard drives made, you could hear it clunking along, same with this. not as quiet as WD black drives. If you want speed in a conventional hard drive, this is it. If you want quiet with a good warranty, buy a WD black series. Note this drive is a 2.5 inch drive mounted in a 3.5 inch aluminum heat-disipating tray.
customer_reviews.author: Daey

customer_reviews.title: Much faster then a normal 5400 or 7200 rpm HDD.  Reliable, THOUGH I would still go with an SSD.
customer_reviews.text: Much faster then a normal 5400 or 7200 rpm HDD. Reliable, THOUGH I would still go with an SSD. This HDD does make little too much noise for me. Even with my case which has sound deadening in it. I get over double the speeds then even some of the fastest 7200 HDDs and way over double of the 5400 HDDs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lagoe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but ...
customer_reviews.text: The Raptor HDD can be everything expected of it, IF installed in and with equipment capable of exploiting it. When installed internally with SATA III, or externally with USB 3.0 connections, the drive is faster than 7200rpm HDDs - I have owned Raptors since they were first introduced, I now own four - the earlier ones ran so hot, you couldn't touch them - the NEWEST one runs a lot cooler, but be careful where you install it - the drive needs air around it
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Feinberg

customer_reviews.title: Be Cautious
customer_reviews.text: The drive received end of May 2015 carries a 2012 date code (3 years old) so more than 3/5 of the warranty is already gone. Further is shows as being setup for an Apple Server. So while label NEW I don't know. We installed as RAID replacement and it is so far working OK
customer_reviews.author: Captain Richard

customer_reviews.title: Love my Raptors
customer_reviews.text: Running two of these in Raid 0 for storing all my games that don't fit on my SSD's. Performance is superb, operation wise, they are way way quieter than the original Raptors. For the storage space you get, the reliability, and rock solid performance, you cannot go wrong! Sadly however I do foresee in the next few years HDD's will pretty much be phasing out. With SSD's already coming way down in price per Gigabyte, it will be just a matter of time. Long live the raptor! :)
customer_reviews.author: JoeyR

customer_reviews.title: Fastest HDD on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: I just couldn't pass up this deal. I've always wanted one of these bad boys and of course it's not SSD fast but I decided to wait on them. I could have gotten the Samsung 840 Evo for a bit more but I really wanted a VelociRaptor. Now according to benchmarks of 2600 hard drives, it currently sits at around 600th place. Much better than what I had which was somewhere in the 1800's. The Evo is 25th place which is an excellent deal for it's performance. It was a very hard decision but I'm happy with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: I love this drive.
customer_reviews.text: It is the cheapest (about $100) fastest (10,000 RPM; SATA 3) drive available. It has a 5 year warranty. It is mostly heat-sink, as the working part is a 2.5 inch drive. This configuration protects it from static a little extra, as the circuit board is not exposed at all. I uses them in pairs (mirrored) or quads (raid10) as raid main drives. With Intel ICH9R, have used on Fedora Linux 17, Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008r2 with no difficulty whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: The Bear

customer_reviews.title: Don't Just Get One!
customer_reviews.text: I added this drive to my Mac Pro Workstation and the performance is outstanding. I had a SSD installed with my OS on it and it booted up really fast. After the boot up, I didn't see any difference between a 7200rpm drive and the SSD. Don't get me wrong. If you put two SSD drives in a RAID 0 with your OS it will scream no matter what. I went with the Raptor drive because the one buy itself out performs the one SSD and the size 1TB is an added bonus. I'm getting a second one for a RAID 0 config. I've read some say that the drive is a little noise... It's not enough to complain.
customer_reviews.author: CaliPVP

customer_reviews.title: Runs fast, but it's super loud.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty fast for an hdd. I use it in conjunction with an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great product and no problems so far
customer_reviews.text: I used to work IT, former MS & Cisco person. I've always used 10K RPM drives in servers, so with my latest home build I decided to install several of these drives and an Intel SSD drive. They're so fast I think that I'll stick to only the 10K RPM drives unless the price of SSD falls enough to be competitive. Great product and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory T.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but may be worth it....
customer_reviews.text: I'm only deducting one star b/c of the price point. The hard drive itself is 5 star quality. I've noticed an increase in speed over my 7200 rpm WD. Mainly in video game load times and computer boot up times. It's a cool-looking hard drive that looks snazzy in my case. I did, however, break the SATA snap off of the hard drive with very little effort. But it still works fine, so no worries. I'd say if you are willing to spend the money, then this HD is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Upgrade for Older Systems
customer_reviews.text: This was chosen for an older system, which would not be able to take advantage of an SSD or TRIM (AMD 710 southbridge). As such, it is dramatically faster than the 7 year old WD5000KS, which it replaced as the boot drive. Synthetic benches are pretty useless, however, do show that this drive is capable of 3x the transfer speeds of the WD5000KS (~180 MB/s ver ~60 MB/s). The important thing is how the drive "feels". With that said, Windows 7 and programs do load noticeably faster. Anyway, this is a great way to breath some new life into an older system, while maintaining full compatibly (no headaches from lack of TRIM support or proper AHCI implementation).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Donovan

customer_reviews.title: WD VelociRaptor
customer_reviews.text: Great drive. No problem in installing it. The drive is very quiet, some commenting about the noise I do not hear any noise and it runs quietly. Also I have no problem with the plastic enclosure I think it is a good protective casing and is very easy to place it in the Dell HD Cradle as I do not have to use any screws. The drive slides in the bay. The drive has a 5 year warranty. I like the WD Drives and bought 4 of these to keep as a backup cloned drives. Peace of mind :-)
customer_reviews.author: Primeas

customer_reviews.title: Best non-ssd system drive you can get for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Update: After heavy usage for nearly 6 years, my drive finally gave out. Nearly 1 year passed the 5-year warranty. Your mileage may vary, but it served me well. I wasn't ready to make the SSD plunge at the time and needed the space so I got this one and have been very happy with it. 10k does the job and it will hold me over until I get an SSD of similar size. Also, I used to put raptors in a Raid 0 and that is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: End User

customer_reviews.title: A fast reliable hard drive
customer_reviews.text: The nice really fast drive. It's been very durable and hasn't given me any trouble. I do a lot of photography and video work in this drive is made a big difference in how my software programs operate. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a very fast reliable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Griego

customer_reviews.title: Great speed not very loud
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some reviews stating that this card is loud. I am not finding this to be true. I set this up as my primary HD in a 4.1 Mac Pro 8 core and have had no issues. The speed boost has the OS leaping to life and ProTools 10 loading all plug-ins in under 30 seconds. I have about 60 large plugins and the old load time was about 2.5 minutes. Good bang for the buck considering the price of SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Buryn

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast, Very Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: These hard drives are fast and they do work flawlessly for years under heavy use. My last Velociraptor was guarantied for 5 years and it lasted me 6 1/2 years. When it finally started to show sign of failure, I only wanted to replace it with another Velociraptor of course. The new ones are a lot more quiet now, very fast and a new well made design. Love it. Very reliable. Recommend 100%.
customer_reviews.author: P.  Ares

customer_reviews.title: Nice Dirve
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these to use as a backup drive in my AsRock M8. The primery dirve is a Corsair GT SSD 480gb. I can only afford one of the SSD's so the best option for me was the WD VelociRaptor with 64m cache. I removed it for its icepack (voids the warranty) but I dont care about that. So fa its been a great drive and its fast. But it roars like a Raptor. Lovely dirve. The performance ranks between SSD and SAS drives.
customer_reviews.author: scsimaster

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: The drive itself is almost the size of an SSD. The rest is just a massive heatsink. I've transferred files back and forth to a Sandisk Extreme on USB 3.0 at almost 190 MB/sec, the full benchmarked speed of the Sandisk. A SATA III interface makes a considerable difference even though the WD won't transfer data at 6 GB/sec. A very good value for a 1TB drive.
customer_reviews.author: surtec

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for a computer I was building for my wife. Very trusted brand and model over the years!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rima

customer_reviews.title: Still working at tops speeds after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Was a little worried about the reliability of this product but after 4 years it’s still preforming like the day I got it. Also it’s blazing fast for an hdd so that is awesome. Seems to be only a little slower than a ssd.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Still kicking butt 7 years after I bought it
customer_reviews.text: And yet all the more expensive Glyph externals are all dead.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: 1 tb velociraptor...quiet and fast
customer_reviews.text: This WD hard drive is to replace my 300GB velociraptor. Loaded up XP again, but this time in the AHCI mode. My motherboard has about a 5 second pause to detect devices ( which is annoying ), but once it finishes, my boot is several seconds faster than the old drive ( cloned ). I am moving to Win 7 64 bit, and will use this drive.....maybe my next drive will be a SSD, but not yet.
customer_reviews.author: Musubi Sam

customer_reviews.title: If speed is what you need!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a boot drive for my home built desktop. I needed the capacity for some of the games I play. This drive is speedy and reliable. I have had no issues with it whatsoever. I have always like Western Digital hard drives, I own 12 of them in my servers and other PCs. I highly recommend these. Of course they work best with a 6gb/s SATA connection on your motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: there is no question as to the reliability of the unit, so far, some 2-3 months into use. it's just that Windows 7 and the new EFI formatting options (the unit comes not formatted) caused the install to be rather tortuous -- tho now all is well, just my inexperience. it looks as tho one could use it as a 21⁄2" drive, but I didn't try: it's is heavy, solid and quiet
customer_reviews.author: Moxy

customer_reviews.title: No documentation, real box, etc. Included, but seems good
customer_reviews.text: It came in a only a brown box with anti-static plastic, not quite what I was expecting, I was hoping to see the awesome "VelociRaptor" box I've seen elsewhere. Not really a big deal though, but would have been nice if it came with some documentation and a real box. As for the actual product, still waiting to set it up, will update with details on how it works once everything is ready.
customer_reviews.author: Elani L.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fast
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of the WD Velociraptor drives in the past and they really keep up their tough work and don't fail on you. I never owned the first generation of them, but all the ones after i have owned and i can attest to them being reliable and their performance is really good especially using RAID 0 (Striping)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Terribly disappointed in these drives
customer_reviews.text: The first drive I purchased in February of 2014 failed in November of that year. The replacement drive managed a year before it started failing as well. I'm terribly disappointed in these drives; given the price and warranty you'd think they would be more reliable. This will be the third drive in less than two years, which is more drive failures than I've had in the past decade or more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Feed Your Raptor and save someones babies
customer_reviews.text: Its smoking fast during network transfers of mixed data content (multimedia, document type, CAD files ) regularly hitting reasonably consistent sustained 200MB/s + throughput values across Gigabit Ethernet (550Mhz Cat6, 150 ft.). (SATA/SAS Intel interface workstation-grade C6x chipset) Compare with Red Editions. Stealthy noise levels too. Feed it your meatiest files daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It's nice, and fairly fast
customer_reviews.text: It's nice, but after a few errors started showing up and reformatting the HD it wouldn't load windows on it, but would load on the other HD just fine, did a disk scan and maybe that fixed the problem, I will replace this with a 240 SSD
customer_reviews.author: Justin English

customer_reviews.title: awesome drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a beast! at about half the speed of a ssd. for this price and the warranty on it are amazing. I have it for booting my games and downloads just fast. On the downside frys had these going for 169.99 but there out of stock and not restocking this amazon had it for lower then the rest of the stores online. Get this drive if you dont like waiting
customer_reviews.author: Josh Buel

customer_reviews.title: Great for gamming
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put all my games on. Helps tremendously with initial load times and load times between levels/zones. I had the 300 GB version of this drive as my boot drive for 3 years and it worked flawlessly. Highly recommend it if, like me, you have a number very large games that access the drive a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Its no SSD but it certainly no slouch with 10000 rpm spin the games I play off of it do load a bit quicker and at least I get the reliability of the HDD and do not have to worry about how many read write speeds I put it through. It even looks impressive in my rig with all the cooling fins. Definitely would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Farfi7139

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 of these. The other is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. The other is a 500GB about 5 years old. using right now on this pc which I use everyday for work. very fast and cost less than SSD. The 1TB is in my gaming PC. Both use Win10 and very fast to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Bumperb

customer_reviews.title: A harddrive, not an SSD
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a boot drive, with a standard 7k harddrive as a storage drive. You can't compare this to an SSD, because it's a harddrive. And if you are like me, who have had their fair share of issues with SSDs over the past few years and want a rock solid performer with a 5 year warranty, this is your harddrive. Windows 8 boots in just a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Keeffer

customer_reviews.title: No drama replacement HDD
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Installed with zero drama on my Phenom black/8GB/Ubuntu 14.04LTS. Migrated dual boot with no difficulties. No major speed change vs 80G Velociraptor, at the work loads I have subjected it to (running VBox, system update & some large file copy tasks). Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: R Abad Santonja

customer_reviews.title: Lasted five years almost on the dot before dying night ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted five years almost on the dot before dying night before last with zero warning. Was a decent drive, but wish it had lasted a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: fast fast fast !
customer_reviews.text: Love these as I have no desire to go with SSD . I just do not thrust them , too many hoops to jump thru and still too expensive. These raptors scream . benched them on a z77 chipset board running in AHCI , tapping in at 180 MPS , not too shabby for a mechanical drive , sure its no SSD but dependibility and a five year warentee form WD sold me
customer_reviews.author: G Craig

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Greatnfor files, and programs. really fast, but I had to take apart my pc to fit this in a upper hd bay as the blackboutter casing kept hitting one of my two 570s. other then that match up to a ssd for your os , youll be super charged
customer_reviews.author: Zombiexm

customer_reviews.title: Fast enough to allow me to hold off on SSD for awhile
customer_reviews.text: 10k Raptors are the only HD's I have used in my numerous home PC builds over the years. Fast and reliable...what more can you want from an HD?
customer_reviews.author: Z06_Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great disk drive but there is one odd thing about it. The drive itself is a 2.5" drive in a 3.5" mount. There's a tag that warns of an invalidation of the warranty if you uncover one of the pins and remove the drive from the case. I can keep it cool myself. I would like to mount it in with some 2.5" SSD drives. Strange.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Rankin

customer_reviews.title: This one is just as cool as any other HDDs
customer_reviews.text: I have an very older version of this. It runs very very hot. This one is just as cool as any other HDDs. Other then my SSDs, this is faster then the 7200-rpm HHDs. I order it in the afternoon. It was promised to be delivered in 2 days. It arrived the very next day. THANKS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: happy2

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: The drive and case are built solid, like a brick. Very easy to install. I have two in a mirror set inside an old (2004) Alienware Area 51 case that I recently gutted and rebuilt with brand new parts. The drives are extremely quiet, my ultra quiet fans are louder, and the pass through speed on 6Gbps were as expected or better. Would recommend this drive for sure. Cons - I wish they had this in a 4TB model.
customer_reviews.author: MD - Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: This drive is my primary drive. 10,000RPM is no joke and this will leave other drives in the dust. When working with large photos having a fast drive is key to getting work done fast. As I don't want to invest in SSD's just yet, the VelociRaptor is the faster HDD you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably faster than 7400rpm drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older 7400rpm harddrive that failed. I was torn between this and an sd drive...mainly a cost/size factor. Ive never had an SD drive before so i cant compare to that, but I ask very happy with the purchase. Only negative is that it is a bit noisier than the previous drive but the speed makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Swartwood

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Furious :-)
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with the moust good new...this thing is Fast and Furious :-) trying to kick some SSD speed. Is not going to happend. But for a mechanical drive this is fast and quiet. I allways had WD RAPTORS... but if you want to put a gaiming sistem together start with an SSD for your OS and than use this for MASS STORAGE/GAMES :-) Yes my friend I do recomand this to you.
customer_reviews.author: vSIG

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive!  Very quick!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised, worked perfectly out of the box! This is a very quick hard drive -- positioned (performance-wise) between an SSD on one side and a standard 7,200 rpm SATA III on the other. I will be getting more of these as I need more drives.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Fast!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The old hard drives in my office server crashed and I decided to replace them with two of these hard drives. The hard drive is extremely fast and we haven't had any issues in our small law office. I was considering buying an ssd drive rather than this drive, but it would have cost twice the price and this is already extremely fast. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fast hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: WD Velociraptor
customer_reviews.text: Arrived rather quickly, packaged very well. I didn't put it in my rig yet but I have had a WD raptor 150GB in my old rig for 6yrs and it worked flawlessly, as a matter of fact it is in my current rig until I replace it with this one. Based on this and the WD reputation I'm sure this will be just as good with tons more room.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Y.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong, but just days away from being replaced by a trio of SSD's...
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Winbush 3rd

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, my second one so far, for a new build. Old one still going strong and fast. Love these drives, good compromise if you want a single, fast 500gb and don't want to pimp out your little sister for the cost of a 500gb-SSD. Nowhere near as fast as the latest SSD's of course, but significantly faster then your average hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Joefuss

customer_reviews.title: great fast drive
customer_reviews.text: These drives are pricey but are the fastest conventional drives you will be able to afford. would be an excellent laptop drive when removed from the frame. I use this for my frequently used programs leaving my SSD's for the OS and essentials to keep the system fast.
customer_reviews.author: Q5Grafx

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, way worth it.
customer_reviews.text: WOW !!! was concerned about the speed but transferring files to and from is only about an average of 8 seconds with 40 gig of files than my SATA 3 SSD. way worth the money, did this 3 times. no noise at all ,great buy.
customer_reviews.author: scott's sells

customer_reviews.title: Well  worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, well made. To make the most of read and write times, I have my OS and much of my frequently used software on a 250gb SSD and my more write-intensive files on a pair of 1Tb Velociraptors. Greatly improved performance all around. Installation is straight forward -- I recommend using "tool free" screws instead of the tiny ones included.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Berzinsky

customer_reviews.title: VRRRRRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMMMM
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. This thing is a workhorse. I use it to store my games for faster loading times, probably doesnt hurt frame rate. All in all a easy to set up, just wish it was cheaper. Can compare to an SSD when you consider price.
customer_reviews.author: BCEAIEN

customer_reviews.title: and this thing has been awesome! It boots faster than my windows laptop
customer_reviews.text: I slapped this puppy in an old core2-duo machine running Debian to try to get some extra life out of it. I primarily surf the net and code, and this thing has been awesome! It boots faster than my windows laptop, and does most tasks far faster. My friends have had far fewer issues with these than SSD's, and I agree that it is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: These WD velociRaptor drives are the best you can buy. Fast and very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Speed x capacity x price
customer_reviews.text: Velociraptor is still a very good choice for good amount of space, very faster data transfer and also a good price if compare with SSD devices. In fact I have in my system a SSD 128G for operation system and velociraptor for data. I am very satisfied with the price x performance of this device.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Silva

customer_reviews.title: This is one blazing HD Drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a must have. Now suddenly my: downloads a blazing fast, Windows starts up are lightning quick, and installs are speed up significantly. What is not to like here? It's a little pricey but pays for itself in saved time you get back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great, I want more, in high capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, and reliable by my standards. I put two in Raid 0, lol maybe don't do that. Anyway, it is completely fine for most of my non essential games, and mostly Virtual Machines.I was pleasantly surprised by the performance boost I've received transferring to it, or off it from my SSD's.
customer_reviews.author: Jeba H

customer_reviews.title: so fast, little on the loud side when loading.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with windows 7 to boot and drive my games it is so fast to load. Only slight draw backs are small capacity and it's a little loud when first loading but after that I never hear it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and fast HDD
customer_reviews.text: i have not had a single issue with this drive. It reads and writes quickly, it is moderately quiet with the exception of that slight chirp that all HDD share, and it has a great memory capacity at 1TB. I typically install all of my development software on this drive as well as games.
customer_reviews.author: Evilzombie

customer_reviews.title: ... for my Steam games and it work so much better compare to my lower speed(64mbps) hard disk that my ...
customer_reviews.text: used this for my Steam games and it work so much better compare to my lower speed(64mbps) hard disk that my counter strike Global offensive hang sometimes while it doesnt hang anymore thanks to this
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Lim Cheng Li

customer_reviews.title: Still a great workhorse
customer_reviews.text: It has been a reliable, fast alternative to an SSD expense. I have yet to see any poor lag times when running Visual Studio, Photoshop, Crysis or any of the other RAM sucking products out there. Also, was a quick install that went real smooth.
customer_reviews.author: KeoghTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Speedy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a Windows 7 machine that made it so much more faster. Have had it at least for 2 years. It has been working with no issues. I used to have a high rate of drive failures until this. Once SSD prices fall further then I might move to a 1TB SSD.
customer_reviews.author: drpret

customer_reviews.title: Long-time Raptor fan
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Raptors and VelociRaptors since my first 73GB version when they were new. I'll pay the premium $$ for a premium product. Fast & quiet. A great addition as a backup drive to my RAID0 SSDs.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: ... this review with this drive so it is working great.
customer_reviews.text: Well Im writting this review with this drive so it is working great. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Midoel Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Velociraptor drives are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Been using Velociraptor drives for years, love the fact it has 1 Tb versions now. I used it with the Vantec NexStar enclosures and they work great. Not as fast as SSD, but with 1 TB there's a lot of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: K Co.

customer_reviews.title: Good bye SSD drives
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it was connect and play as my new C Drive. So what, my start up is fractionally slower than the SSD (Kingston) but I have confidence I'll enjoy many years trouble free OS with this product. Get one and do yourself a system favor.
customer_reviews.author: Acts28brian

customer_reviews.title: This drive is wickedly fast. If you need more storage than SSD Spend the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This drive is wickedly fast. I have a fairly high performance machine. It already has 3 of the highest rated SSD's that Intel and Samsung offer. Considered 1 GB SSD, but price well north of $1,000 and the fact that SSD's are known to be more likely to fail without warning gave me pause. (I am running over clocked processor (6 core) on P79 deluxe board and 64B of RAM)
customer_reviews.author: OceanSurf

customer_reviews.title: I higly recommend it for working place
customer_reviews.text: Has been working so well for many years!!!, I higly recommend it for working place.
customer_reviews.author: Aner Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Fast?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is any faster than my 7200rpm WD black drive. Hopefully it will be as reliable. It is a little louder than newer drives. Sounds like hearing someone on some old strap on metal wheel roller skates on the street from about 80 yards away.
customer_reviews.author: RealReviewCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and this is a top rated drive. The drive was delivered promptly and I installed it with no problems. It works great! There is not much else I can say until I've had this thing for a few years. See you then!
customer_reviews.author: Razor

customer_reviews.title: Installed & image, up & running on my system ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed & image, up & running on my system. This is the 3rd Raptor I used in my system. Only reason replaced system drive was because it was full.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Swiger

customer_reviews.title: Good Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is really very good, speed is very stable and fast for a mechanical disk drive, with the only disk I have is against noise when writing data, but it is normal for all records generated, rest has many pro when searching for a top drive in all mechanical drives.
customer_reviews.author: SoulxFenix

customer_reviews.title: Fast like an SSD
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, almost like an SSD. It was the perfect replacement for the aging hard drive in our server. And the WD Acronis cloning software made the switch very easy.
customer_reviews.author: JEH-IT

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Have it as the data drive on the new computer I built. The C:/ is a 480 GB SSD. Hardly notice a difference in speed when going between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Astro

customer_reviews.title: Noisiest Drive Ever
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's 10,000 RPM and it's fast. I haven't done any benchmarks, but it's noticeably faster than my old SATA 2 WD Black drives. This is the noisiest drive I've owned since 2004. I thought once I left behind my ancient old 160 GB drive from an HP computer, I wouldn't have to listen to this racket again. I was trying to strike a balance between needing 1 TB of storage, some extra speed and not having to sell my firstborn for a 1 TB SSD. Maybe I'm just used to the silence of my old 500 GB WD Black drives, but this is pretty close to not being worth it. Very sorry I ponied up for this Velociraptor.
customer_reviews.author: Tomato Woman

customer_reviews.title: Beast i wish i got the 1tb but im happy with 500gb its so so fast especially with windows ...
customer_reviews.text: Beast i wish i got the 1tb but im happy with 500gb its so so fast especially with windows 8 feels like a mini SSD with boot up speeds.
customer_reviews.author: H. Charlotten

customer_reviews.title: Great price and buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fast drive and great for gaming. Just a heads up when installing into computer..If you're running W7 make sure you go into manage system and enable the harddrive and format it.
customer_reviews.author: RyG

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fast.  Surprisingly Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: This fast is insanely fast. Its read/write capability is stunning, and its seek times are almost non-existent. This is a perfect cheap alternative to an SSD. I recommend this over any other HHD.
customer_reviews.author: MotoRider42HC

customer_reviews.title: The best mechanical hard drive available
customer_reviews.text: I like these drives in RAID-1 for server builds where SSDs are not appropriate. They are extremely fast, not too loud and rock solid. They will definitely destroy 7200RPM drives for performance.
customer_reviews.author: Upgrade Taos Computers

customer_reviews.title: Needed a fast, reliable, large capacity drive
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast, large capacity drive for photo editing and storage. SSDs are still too expensive. The Velociraptor drives are well known for their speed and reliability. It has worked great so far and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: it is a very good hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This item is listed as having a 5 year warranty. Just contact WD and was told it is a OEM product and is not warranty . It also is old and has been used. It has been power on 196 times. It has 10303 power on hours, so it not new. Amazon need to apply some action against them for FRAUD ALERT for not listed as a used item.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Fast & furious
customer_reviews.text: So happy with the 1st one I purchased, I bought a second one. This thing really moves and I've been most impressed with the speed. I knew it was going to be faster than my 7200 platters but WOW does this thing move out!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Scheffler

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast and item was in perfect condition. The speed at witch this drive runs when installed in a USB 3.0 external enclosure is unreal.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Wagley

customer_reviews.title: Photographers and Gamers need this drive!
customer_reviews.text: Simply AMAZING! As a photographer, I need speed, storage capacity, and reliability. That's what you get with this drive. You get what you pay for. Gamers and photographers need this drive!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mckeown

product_meta.title: WD Velociraptor WD1000DHTZ 1TB 3.5" SATA Hard Drive
product_meta.description: Capacity:1 TBWD VelociRaptor drives offer an unmatched combination of high performance and high reliability, perfect for workstations, high-end video and photo editing, low-end servers and performance enthusiast's systems. Comes with a 3.5-inch mounting frame for easy installation into today's high-performance systems and chassis. Ultra fast - Designed around a 10,000 RPM spin speed, these SATA 6 Gb/s drives include a 64 MB cache and deliver the ultimate performance for photo and video editing. Rock-solid reliability - With 1.4 million hours MTBF, these drives have the highest available reliability rating on a high capacity SATA drive. High capacity - State-of-the-art technology delivers a balance of high performance and high capacity perfect for data-intensive workloads that require large amounts of storage such as video editing, 3D rendering and scientific modeling. Ultra-cool operation – Consumes less idle power and uses similar active power as the previous generation WD VelociRaptor, while offering higher capacity and performance. Advanced Format (AF) – Technology adopted by WD and other drive manufacturers as one of multiple ways to continue growing hard drive capacities. AF is a more efficient media format that enables increased areal densities. IcePack mounting frame - The 2.5-inch hard drive is enclosed in a backplane-ready 3.5-inch mounting frame with a built-in heat sink that keeps this powerful little drive extra cool when installed in high-performance desktop chassis. NoTouch ramp load technology – The recording head never touches the disk media ensuring significantly less wear to the recording head and media as well as better drive protection in transit. Pre-emptive Wear Leveling (PWL) – Ensures reliability for applications that perform a high incidence of read/write operations at the same physical location on the disk. Rotary Acceleration Feed Forward (RAFF) – Optimizes operation and performance when the drives are used in vibration-prone, multi-drive chassis. Environmentally Conscious – In addition to being RoHS compliant, this generation of WD VelociRaptor also provides a halogen-free design. Compatible with: PC; Mac
feature_bullets: Ultra fast - Designed around a 10,000 RPM spin speed, these SATA 6 Gb/s drives include a 64 MB cache and deliver the ultimate performance for photo and video editing
Rock-solid reliability - With 1.4 million hours MTBF (Mean Time Between Failure), these drives have the highest available reliability rating on a high capacity SATA drive

High capacity - State-of-the-art technology delivers a balance of high performance and high capacity perfect for data-intensive workloads that require large amounts of storage such as video editing, 3D rendering and scientific modeling
1 TB capacity holds up to 200,000 digital photos, 250,000 MP3 files, and 120 hours of HD video
